content:
It sounds like you're having a great time experimenting with watercolor techniques! Wet-on-wet and glazing can be a bit tricky, but it's wonderful that you're persisting and learning as you go. Transparent washes and layering are great ways to achieve that soft, dreamy light, and I'm sure your pieces are turning out beautifully.

I'm so jealous that you got to visit Paris! Even though you didn't make it to Giverny, I'm sure you still had an amazing time soaking up the art and culture. And what a wonderful souvenir haul you got! Those art postcards and the handmade journal with a watercolor cover must be such inspirations.

Now, about your grandmother's old oil painting... Oh, I'm so excited to hear that you're getting it restored! It's wonderful that you're preserving family heirlooms and giving new life to a piece that holds sentimental value. What's the story behind the painting? Was it a favorite of your grandmother's, or did she create it herself?

And how's the restoration process going? Are you working with a local conservator or restorer? I hope it turns out beautifully and you get to enjoy it for years to come!
